website_summaries.verdict: For the price, this mini bike pump includes plenty of accessories and features.
pros: With the built-in gauge, bike bell, mounting kit, and repair tools, there’s a lot to love about this low-priced pump
The gauge is dependable and easy to read, and customers like this pump for its construction and lightweight design
The repair tools are a nice added touch
cons: A few people have reported issues getting the pump to inflate their tires properly

customer_reviews.title: Handy bike pump! A+
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump for my husband to replace his old one and wow he's impressed! All the parts and pieces were packaged nicely and the instructions were super clear. The pump is really cute and easy to use. It pumped air into his bike really fast and smoothly. Overall I would recommend this pump! Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: I Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I Love it! Just what you need, compact, you don't notice it's on your bike (easy to install), was biking Sunday with the kids and needed to fill the air worked great. Thanks for the bonus bell SAMLITE is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pump a while ago and I am highly satisfied with this bike pump, it is a strong and sturdy and is very easy to pump up my bike tire. The tire patching kit is a bonus but I hope I will never have to use it, I feel safe having it with me while riding. Bike bell is a good bonus as well. Overall I highly recommend this bike pump. I'm very happy. Five star all the way!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: I would give it 10 star!
customer_reviews.text: BUY THIS PUMP! This is so easy to use and is light in weight, and works like a charm. It feels well made. PSI gauge works great and I was able to mount on bike with the mounting kit that is included. Ball needle is included so I can inflate my balls.... kids are happy. Love it. Five star it is !
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: I like the pressure gauge and the extra gadgets that come ...
customer_reviews.text: This mini Bike pump, is small but strong and very durable. I like the pressure gauge and the extra gadgets that come with it. It came exactly as described. My kids used it to pump there balls and bikes. and is very handy to take with on a trip while biking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far this one works great, but I've only used it twice
customer_reviews.text: I had a name-brand one of these for years, a broken compression ring cause a warranty replacement, which failed the same, in time. So far this one works great, but I've only used it twice, so we'll see how it holds up with usage.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Hilgendorf

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this pump
customer_reviews.text: using both valve types, I was unable to actually inflate tire, I strapped it to my bike anyways and thought in an emergency it might work. That didn’t go over well. Was on a ride with a friend, he needed to inflate his tire, this pump broke while trying to fit on. The actuating head popped off and a small SS pin inside fell out. Had it less than a month and it broke. I’m not happy with this product, it needs to be redesigned for practical use.
customer_reviews.author: jake allen

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE - bought on June 9th - broken July 29 - Cheap garbageLight, compact and connects to the frame
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for a cheap safety pump for trail rides. Super easy to mount to the frame. I did my research and this was by far the best value. UPDATE - After 7 weeks, so using it maybe three times the housing came apart. Very cheap plastic retainer ring holding the housing together, it cracked and now the pump is useless. To amend my review - NOT good for safety if it can't be trusted to work, and its still CHEAP - in price and build
customer_reviews.author: Ethan L.

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service, nice pump for emergencies
customer_reviews.text: I was mainly looking for a bike pump in case I needed to replace a tire on the go. Had an issue with the initial order and customer service was very quick to respond and help me out; 5 stars. I’ve attached the included bracket with pump to the spare water bottle holder on the vertical frame of my road bike and it fits well. Pump is about the same diameter of my frame and doesn’t get in the way. Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Xmas Elf

customer_reviews.title: Great Pump and Accessories
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this little pump a couple of weeks back. Took the one day shipping as I need the pump to pump up my Electric Scooter tires as I was using the scooter for a work event. When I opened the package up I noticed the plastic cover, covering the air gauge was broken (No big deal the pump and gauge worked fine). I reached out to Samlite INC. support and let them know the state of the pump when it arrived, and with out a beat they sent me out a brand new pump out. All is good with the new pump. If for no other reason, buy from Samlite INC as they stand behind their product and customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Keith H.

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: The only positive thing about this product is it's light weight and that's all. Pressure Gauge did not work at all. I had a flat tire while riding on a long commute and thought that I would be okay. Patched the hole in my inner tube and Used this product once and it broke in 6 pumps. I had to walk to the nearest bike shop which was 2.5 miles away. Very disappointed. I carry my basketball pump now for emergency situations because it's reliable unlike this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't even pump air into the tires.
customer_reviews.text: The unit I got must be defective. Tires would deflate while pumping once I got to around 75 and eventually it stopped pumping air altogether. Would not recommend for 23mm road bike tires. This is better for mountain bikes if anything.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Look for better option
customer_reviews.text: I got this to carry in a pouch on my bike as part of an emergency kit. It will work ok if you only need to pump up a tire or two but beyond that it started coming apart. The head is fastened with two small pins that go through thin and cheap plastic holes. These holes started breaking while using the pump because of the air pressure. I have had to throw it away because the head came completely off and was not repairable.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Travis Blake

customer_reviews.title: Fits both presta and Schrader....
customer_reviews.text: Received this around march 2020...So glad I have this..as it fits both presta and Schrader valves....the only shop in my area does not always have what you need due to this covid shut down...so on one of my bikes I have one of each valves...on the other I have both the same...so I'm good....and it comes with a tire gauge on it so you know how much pressure you are putting in...will see how long it will last...
customer_reviews.author: antonio franscio

customer_reviews.title: It broke on my first use. Can’t go over 40 PSI
customer_reviews.text: I bike to work occasionally which is about 13 miles. I had this pump as a backup incase I ever had a flat. Well today on the way to work I got a flat and when I tried to pump up the new tube the pump would not go over 40 PSI. A rubber gasket kept blowing out which deflated the tire. I kept putting the gasket back in place and eventually the top just shot off and let all the air out of the tire. I’m very disappointed I had this Incase of emergency and it didn’t work when I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: Head broke off after second use!
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the most recent reviews instead of just the top ones. Like others have mentioned, the head broke off mine on the first try, around 40psi. Now it casually pops off under any amount of pressure making it impossible to fill tire.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: A literal piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: Upon first attempting to use this pump, it immediately disintegrated into several pieces. Pulling it out of the box, the cheap plastic cover over the pressure gauge came off of the gauge - it was already broken apparently. When I went to use the pump the head broke off of the pump immediately. Next, I go to pull the head off my valve and it wouldn't come off. I end up shearing the valve off of my tube, resulting in a compromised tube. So, I had to replace my tube as well. Literally the worst product I've ever purchased. See attached photo.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler Carrico

customer_reviews.title: the permormance is not as good as expected
customer_reviews.text: It is a good pump. The performance is just a bit below expected as the handling is not really comfortable. Any way, it is a good option for a carry on pump.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Very good pump. I love that it has two valve sizes so that I can help out any of my biking buddies who have the bigger valve. PSI gauge is accurate. I don't like having extra accessories on my bike so I keep the pump in my backpack and it's so light that it barely adds any weight to my regular load. I haven't had to use the tire repair kit yet, but it's in my bag at all times just in case. The free bell is awesome, i gave it to my brother and he forgave me for killing his goldfish
customer_reviews.author: Moshe D

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine twice...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pump as a portable pump to keep on my bike in case I needed it. The first two times I used it it worked fine. The third time, I got to about 45psi (which it's supposed to handle way more) the pressure caused the handle to separate the head. Now air just leaks when trying to use it. Looks elsewhere for a pump because this is not durable whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Comes with a Bell!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Exactly what I ordered. It is quick and portable and you can even install it to the Frame of your bike so you can have it with you forever. It is not cheap and is built to last. It also comes with a bell! Dope
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good looking, and functional
customer_reviews.text: I find the black and chrome contrast appealing, and the small size can fit in a small pouch or installed into to the water bottle mount on a bike frame; bracket and screws included. The rubber strap holds the pump firmly in place and it even has an integrated tire gauge that you can read while pumping in air. Two fittings for either a Schrader or Presta valve, a needle for basketballs, volley balls... a patch kit, and bell make it a great package deal. Well worth it I think.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Good Pump, Lousy Mount
customer_reviews.text: The pump is nice and works well, but the mounting bracket leaves a little to be desired. I have mine mounted vertically and it wants to slide out of the mount. I put a small piece of anti-skid drawer liner behind it and it made a huge difference. The only thing holding it into the mount is basically a large O-Ring. If this were mounted horizontally it would likely be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Head broke off during first real use.
customer_reviews.text: I had a low tire that needed topped off so I finally found a reason to use this pump for the first time. The head broke off, deflated my tire completely, and I had to walk my bike to a gas station. I can’t recommend this pump.
customer_reviews.author: jeff clements

customer_reviews.title: Broke on my first use. Not built well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a while ago, but have been too busy to bike until today. I went to air up my tires with this and didn't even finish the first one until this thing start hissing and then blew apart. It seems like it can't handle the stress at high PSI. Wish I could get my money back, but it is too late now.
customer_reviews.author: Brett S

customer_reviews.title: It is compact and easy to use for inflating the wheel
customer_reviews.text: It is compact and easy to use for inflating the wheel. Only thing that didn't work for me was the pressure gage. I'm not sure if it doesn't work or I am using it wrong but there aren't instructions on how to test the pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Candace Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: It took less than a minute to fill up the the tire. Very easy to use. The vendor forgot to include the little instruction card on repairing the tube. But the instruction is on the picture online. Everything else, including the air pump instruction, was included.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Myers

customer_reviews.title: Small pump that packs a punch
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item. I have used this item to put air in my mountain bike and used to inflate a basketball. Its a mini pump but it works pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kareem Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for city bikes
customer_reviews.text: Other than the gauge not a working unit Perfect size, easy to use, and so far works great Took no time at all to get two FLAT tires filled and working Recommend- just don't expect the gauge to work
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Gage doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: So the pump works but the gage does not! Clearly it’s just for looks I purchased this for my bike but didn’t have a need to use it until yesterday which happened to be 32 days after buying it so I can’t exchange or return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: as soon as I tried pumping up my tire beyond 30 psi, air started leaking out of the pump and eventually the back flew off and broke my tire inlet valve
customer_reviews.author: Drew H

customer_reviews.title: Head broke off after 6 uses
customer_reviews.text: Was working ok, slight leak internally in the piece while working but it didn't really affect the progress. It is very hard to pump over 60 psi and it doesn't seem to want to put any more than that pressure into anything. Then the head popped off when I pumped up the last tire to 60 psi and it can not be simply popped back on. It's trash now.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor G

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need for roadside flat fix. This could ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything you need for roadside flat fix. This could be the difference between riding home and walking a bike with a flat. Bring a pair of disposable gloves to keep the chain oil mess to a minimum. I also added Velcro straps to keep the pump on the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Spaulding

customer_reviews.title: Broke first use
customer_reviews.text: Used this once. Bought it for my new mountain bike, and it broke the first use. I connected it to the Presta valve connection, and started pumping. I was supporting the head on the valve, and as I approached 40 PSI, the head separated from the rest of the pump. Looked like there should've been a pin holding them together, but there was nothing. I also bent the stem on the valve. Luckily it still seats.
customer_reviews.author: David Williams

customer_reviews.title: Presta and Schrader valves both work fine
customer_reviews.text: Tried Presta and Schrader valves on my bikes, both work fine. Tested the built-in pressure guage with my digital guage; reading is about 5 psi OVER the actual reading on my digital pressure guage. The pump does not pump more than 40 psi on my bike; very hard to pump after 40 psi on the built in guage. Sometimes I am worry it my break the air valves, I might pick a pump with rubber host. Overall I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley

customer_reviews.title: This is a great portable bike pump
customer_reviews.text: This is a great portable bike pump. It fits in my pocket book so i can easily take it with me when we take our kids bike or stroller with air tires as it works great and it is very easy to use. I have used it already several times for pumping up kids bikes and even worked for a stroller air tire. I would definitely recommend as your portable bike pump to always keep with you.
customer_reviews.author: B. Blue

customer_reviews.title: impossible
customer_reviews.text: absolutely impossible to use on my presta valve. very poor quality. would give less than 1 star if it were possible.
customer_reviews.author: Beck

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great price. I had a question about install and they responded very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Good value package for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good value package for the price, it was well worth the money the air gauge on the pump is a great idea.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce T Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great product but instructions are lacking for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I've just opened the package and the pump works great! There are redundant instructions for using the pump on the back of the box as well as inside, which is also great! That said, there aren't any instructions for the rest of the contents of the kit. This might not be an issue for experienced cyclists, but personally, as an amateur, I don't really know what I'm looking at with some of these parts and there aren't instructions for how to use these patches or other things. While the internet is obviously an option to learn, it would have been nice if there were some included instructions for these other repair pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Brave

customer_reviews.title: It works, but you get what you pay for what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This air pump works, and the gauge seems to work well, but it's cheap. You definitely get what you pay for. I have not tried to mount this on my bike, but I did try to attach the included bell and it broke while installing it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G.

customer_reviews.title: handy and compact pump.
customer_reviews.text: it's the perfect pump to keep in your carriage basket if it has pumped wheels. it's always handy in case you need to put some air in the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mark

customer_reviews.title: How to check the pressure?
customer_reviews.text: Everything what came in the package looks pretty nice but the pressure display doesn't work for some reason. The arrow stuck at the bottom and doesn't go up.
customer_reviews.author: Daria B

customer_reviews.title: not great!
customer_reviews.text: this seemed so easy to use but on the second use when trying to fill tire to psi required the while front part broke off and its no longer usable - not highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Sara Kramarik

customer_reviews.title: I really liked all the options that came with the Pump
customer_reviews.text: I really liked all the options that came with the Pump. I especially like the dial the let me measure the PSI of each of my strollet tires. I really like how compact the pump was. It fit perfectly on my road bike with the added attachment. It also came with a couple needles to pump a football and basketball that I have. Overall this pump has many accessories. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: benzi

customer_reviews.title: A deflating experience
customer_reviews.text: this product was disappointing. I attempted to inflate my husband’s flat tire just before we plan to go for a ride... And it nearly deflated the tire. Try to give it a second chance. While I was out with my granddaughter she needed just a little bit of air. So we pulled out the pump. It deflated her tire in the middle of a trail. We had to flag someone down with a reliable pump
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Davis

customer_reviews.title: Lack of Pump Functionality in Two Uses
customer_reviews.text: The pump included in this kit did not perform well or last long. Upon the first use it would not pump greater than 60 psi. The second time I used it the upper attachment allowed air out around the O_ring and the top broke off. I have owned the pump for less than three weeks. I would not purchase this item again and would like a full refund for the lack of functionality of the pump
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Shearer

customer_reviews.title: The best I could of get
customer_reviews.text: Title: Easy to pump Review: I received this pump a few days ago and I tested it today on my mountain bike. This bike pump is amazing. Pumping is so much easier and more efficient than my last pump, and this thing seems high quality so I don't think it'll get any tears (like my last pump did). Bike bell is a good bonus and I love the PSI gauge, it works very well and accurate. FIVE STAR !
customer_reviews.author: Chaim Linder

customer_reviews.title: If you ride a bike 🚲 like I do, then buy this awesome bike pump!! 💯 💯 💯
customer_reviews.text: I love this pump, it fits perfectly in the bike 🚲 bag I also ordered from Amazon. The pump also has a gage on it, it arrived about ten minutes ago, one of three arriving today!! Thanks Amazon for such wonderful products and even greater service, you guys are awesome!!! 💯 💯 💯 So loving this bike 🚲 pump tho 😁 😁 😁 👌👌👌💯💯
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lee

customer_reviews.title: This item is crap. Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap pump doesn’t even work. Don’t waste your money. It sure in hell will not pump up road bike tires. Such a scammmmm!
customer_reviews.author: kyran

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Had a problem with the initial pump and I had a replacement within a couple of days. I've had to use it twice and the new one has worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Maybe look at something else
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this is that the mount is not sturdy enough. Not sure I’d this is a unique problem to this product or would be a problem to all similar.
customer_reviews.author: Tak

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pump!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It's great pump for my bike so that I don't have to carry heavy pump. It also has list that are for emergency and tire changer! It's a must buy for lightweight and starting kit. Also it has gauge for a precise psi and bar for anything you need to pump
customer_reviews.author: Jan C.

customer_reviews.title: Don't force the valve stem in to far.
customer_reviews.text: Used the pump twice and it worked well. Getting up to pressure wasn't easy, but I managed to get enough air into the tire to make it home. Pushing the valve too far into the socket resulted in leaking air. Pushing the valve into the socket just enough for it to get a grip ensures a good seal with no leaking.
customer_reviews.author: LibraryD

customer_reviews.title: Won't inflate. Broke during first use.
customer_reviews.text: Would give 0 stars if possible. I never got the pump to go beyond 40psi (was targetting 70). During the first use plastic cover of gauge somehow broke just trying to rotate the piece so I could see it (it is meant to be rotated) and the full head of the pump just broke (see pictures). Now I have a tire at 10psi I need to remove and go inflate at tire shop or LBS and a literally broken pump which meant throwing my money away.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Difficult mount
customer_reviews.text: The pump works very well. Top of the line pump. The mount for the pump is difficult. That is why I knocked off a star. The “screws” to mount the mount were very soft and stripped very easy on aluminum. I ended up using steel wood screws that did the trick. Besides the mount being difficult would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Pump is flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Nice little kit, but the pump is very flimsy. I already broke one the first time I used it, and the replacement is not something I would depend on.
customer_reviews.author: Liz H1000

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first use
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first use, i didn't even get the bike type to full pressure. Utter disappointment i want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: R. Adam Estep

customer_reviews.title: I really like it.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is perfect. It looks great it's easy to use it works great and seems to be very durable. I think it's the perfect size for a beach cruiser. someone that has a really expensive mountain bike may think the gauges too big and bulky.... But for a man's beach cruiser it's ideal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Infurna

customer_reviews.title: Compact and functional
customer_reviews.text: This is a bargain for the price. I bought it to take on a trip and the compact size, and having a gauge available is great. Fit the presta valve which is what my bike has. Im buying another one as I gave the original as a gift to my cousin. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Juan L.

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Went to check pressures in my tire and it blew apart. Couldn't have been much more than 100psi and yet it literally came apart in pieces.
customer_reviews.author: S. D. R.

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking for better quality.😟
customer_reviews.text: Kinda cheap. Awkward to use not at all user friendly. GAUGE DOES NOT WORK AT ALL!! I would be hesitant to recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Small and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: It's not as easy to use as I thought it would be. It is small, so it's great for on the road air, but it's a workout pumping the air in.
customer_reviews.author: mimicici

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This small, poorly made pump will not be able to pump air in a bikes tires before it breaks. Best used to pump up footballs and basketballs I would assume.
customer_reviews.author: John Craig Laquidara

customer_reviews.title: OK for emergency
customer_reviews.text: It's OK for emergencies, but don't expect to fill a bike tire. Took me several hundred strokes to increase tire pressure 20 lbs. But it's better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Bevy

customer_reviews.title: Mounting bracket is not a snug fit. Pump will fall out while riding
customer_reviews.text: Pump works like it should. The piece to mount it to the bike is not a snug fit which prevents you from mounting it which bothers me cause the pump will fall out when you are riding.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M

customer_reviews.title: Nice pump. Disappointed with missing contents.
customer_reviews.text: Missing puncture repair kit and bike bell as described in product description. Box arrived only with pump, bike attachment and sports needle. Box didn’t seem missing a sticker seal or anything like that. Amazon package was in tack upon delivery. Not a big deal to me as I have tire levers and patches. But for someone buying this as a first time item is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: la1980

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I love that even though this is small they did compromise on quality. A great item.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: So hard to use
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so hard to figure out. Sometimes I can get it to work and most of the time I cant. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieR

customer_reviews.title: Compact and very useful package
customer_reviews.text: Great customer support Compact and very useful package I like the small bell addiction
customer_reviews.author: pini

customer_reviews.title: and pumps up the tire great. The free bell is a nice touch as ...
customer_reviews.text: Attaches to the bike well, and pumps up the tire great. The free bell is a nice touch as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Dunn

customer_reviews.title: One would have huge arms after using this pump!
customer_reviews.text: The pump is built well. It’s easy to use. Comes with many accessories. The gauge works well. But the pump itself is useless. Had to add just 4 pounds to a tire I had to pump it almost 50 times. Wouldn’t want to think how many times if I had a flat.
customer_reviews.author: Vince DaGrosa

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed me and a flat tire
customer_reviews.text: Had a flat on my way to my friend's house, everything was good except the pump. The cheap rubber cap on the pump broke off, and the pump would not pump air more than 20-35psi and would leak if anymore pressure was pumped. Not the best but in my opinion, but definitely an okay kit to have. Just don't include the pump.
customer_reviews.author: jenping j wang

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I ordered. Pump gets real hard to pump when the psi gets close to the tire max psi.
customer_reviews.author: steven steinman

customer_reviews.title: Works great for bikes and we also used it for an ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great for bikes and we also used it for an exercise ball as well. The kit came with a useful bracket to attach to your bike as well.
customer_reviews.author: Felix & Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect just what I was looking for and love the size fits everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality. Failed on first use.
customer_reviews.text: Broke on the first time I needed to use it. Luckily, someone else in our riding group had a pump that worked. I should have read other review who had similar problems. Unfortunately, the window to return and get refund expired after a month, 2 weeks before I first discovered it was a defective pump.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gap

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: This wouldn't pump up my bike tires at all. Great idea as far as size and being so lightweight, just needs to be redesigned so it will actually fill the tires with air instead of just deflating them...
customer_reviews.author: cassi

customer_reviews.title: Broke the pump, saved by the bell.
customer_reviews.text: I had to air up my bike tires. I put this on the valve, and with the first pump, the small amount of pressure broke the head off. Did not even work once. But hey, it came with a bell, irons(that look like they wont work) and tiny patches. So that's nice.
customer_reviews.author: Tea person

customer_reviews.title: OK bike pump
customer_reviews.text: nice bike pump with repair kit. However as one has mentioned, it doesn't do much for a road bike. Could not pump over 80psi so will need to purchase another bike pump.
customer_reviews.author: Vang

customer_reviews.title: The pump kit arrived quickly and seems to be just ...
customer_reviews.text: The pump kit arrived quickly and seems to be just what I need, but will have to wait to see how durable it is.

customer_reviews.title: Compact and durable
customer_reviews.text: It's small enough to fit into my sons backpack, so he can always have it with him. I like the 2 different sizes. The fixing kit accesoires comes with a handy box.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but holder is not effective
customer_reviews.text: Its a good pump, but the bike mount holding the pump is not as tight as it should be. When I strap the pump in, its fine at first, but it is not tight enough and eventually slips down. I have out a piece of athletic tape around the body where it clamps onto the holder. to avoid it from slipping

customer_reviews.text: The pump itself works great! I have low pressure tires, and it pumps fine. My only problem is that the gauge never leaves zero, so I'm just doing guesswork here.

customer_reviews.title: Used first time and handle came off in hand
customer_reviews.text: After using it for the first time, I got several pumps into my tire and then the handle popped off in my hand and all the air came out of my tire. I tried to pop it back together and I did get it back together, but now not sure I want this pump with me when I go out on a trail.

customer_reviews.title: Compact and quality product
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality bike pump. I my past experiences, bike pumps have always taken up a ton of space, and this guy fits anywhere with its mini design. And it is not made cheaply either! Best of both worlds, would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jacko

customer_reviews.title: Gauge does not function on the presta opening
customer_reviews.text: The pump works fine but the pressure gauge does not work on the presta fitting. Considering all three of my bikes run presta valves I was extremely disappointed. I tried it on a standard valve and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: James

product_meta.title: SAMLITE New Mini Bike Pump Portable Bicycle Frame Pump Glue Less Puncture Repair Kit Presta and Schrader Valve Includes Mount Kit Pressure 120 PSI 8 Bar Free Bike Bell Sports Needle Included
feature_bullets: ► High Quality: The SAMLITE Mini Bike Pump is composed of superior quality durable aluminum alloy body with a fine satin finish. Ultra-durable design and easy to carry. With a 120 PSI capacity, Mini Bike Pump can be used to inflate bike tires during emergency repairs or simply to maintain tire pressure over the course of a season. It’s the only pump you need to take with you, but it’s also the only pump you need in your garage.

► Ultra Lightweight: Portable Bike pump is almost weightless and extremely compact that can be attached to the bike frame under the water bottle cage with the mounting bracket. The length of bike pump is 10.5”

► Bonus Bike Pump Accessories: Comes with pocket sized Glue-Less puncture repair kit along with mounting bike attachment bracket, bike bell ,and sports needle to Inflate sports balls such as basketballs, footballs, soccer balls

► Easy To Use: Identify the type of tire valve and use the corresponding Presta or Schrader valve on the pump. Ensure the tire is rotated so that the valve is near the ground, unscrew the tire valve cap. Remove grey rubber cap from pump, place the pump onto the tire valve. Pull back grey lever until pump is tightened securely onto tire. Inflate the tire to the recommended pressure. Remove the pump from the tire valve and refit the valve cap!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
